title: Textile, "Palmhive® Bobble Camouflage Net", designed 1998, manufactured 2004
medium:
Medium: polyester and Lycra™
Technique: warp-knitted
provenance: Given by the manufacturer on the occasion of the exhibition Extreme Textiles.
creditline: Gift of Palmhive® Technical Textiles Ltd.
description: A dark green knit fabric with a varied and highly dimensional surface. Designed for the Ministry of Defense, United Kingdom, as a tank camouflage system called "Quick Cam."
justification: This textile, which was designed in 1998 and manufactured in 2004 by Palmhive® Technical Textiles in England for the United Kingdom’s Ministry of Defense, is comprised of knitted polyester and Lycra, and acts as three dimensional camouflage for tanks and other military equipment. It is produced in the traditional camouflage colors of green, black, and khaki. The sculptural and highly textured surface of this stretch fabric provides a more realistic disguise for the large equipment it conceals. This particular textile is very unique in that it is a knitted textile structures meant purely for industrial application. It demonstrates the ways in which fabrics can enhance safety, but it also shows the unintended intrinsic beauty of many industrial textiles.

tombstone.epitaph:
